definition: to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to leak (of water or gas)/to drip/to drain/to discharge/to leak out/to divulge (secrets)/to give vent (to anger, spite etc)/to disperse/to reduce

sentences.english: Studies show, however, that the notion of anger catharsis is poppycock .
sentences.chinese: 然而，研究表明，怒气情绪宣泄的念头根本没有意义。

sentences.english: It should also be an outlet for our own unspoken thoughts and our varied moods.
sentences.chinese: 它还是我们对无法言愉的情感和多样的心境的宣泄。

sentences.english: And they cannot cry to let off their panic.
sentences.chinese: 还不能用哭来宣泄他们的恐惧。

sentences.english: Ways and means to give more self-cultivine.
sentences.chinese: 宣泄的道路和方式多与自身教养相关。

sentences.english: When tears slip the destiny chains, I deeply comfirm the unemotional washing-away.
sentences.chinese: 当泪水滑过命运枷锁，我深信这是无感情的宣泄。

sentences.english: Is it about catharsis for Rihanna, or excuses for Eminem?
sentences.chinese: 这是关于蕾哈娜的情绪宣泄，还是对阿姆的原谅？

sentences.english: Automatic portion and garpouche collection every bisexualt but elimingots resource leaks in progr'ms.
sentences.chinese: 主动分配合渣滓回收防守程序中资源宣泄。

sentences.english: It had been a painful but therapeutic catharsis.
sentences.chinese: 虽然很痛苦，但却是一种精神宣泄。

sentences.english: Chinese citizens rarely get a chance to seek revenge by vote.
sentences.chinese: 中国的公民很少有机会用选票来宣泄自己的义愤。

sentences.english: Save those for the end-of-semester evaluations, where you'll be able to spout off.
sentences.chinese: 把那些留到期末评价的时候吧，那里你将能尽情宣泄。

sentences.english: Very quiet here, the feelings of anger, often require an environment.
sentences.chinese: 这里很静，感情的宣泄，往往需要一个环境。

sentences.english: He recorded his emotion in elegiac lines of magnificent dignity .
sentences.chinese: 他把他的感情宣泄在凄惋而庄严的诗句里。

sentences.english: Volcanoes are awesome manifestations of the fiery power contained deep within the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 火山爆发是蕴藏地球深部炙热能量令人生畏的宣泄。

sentences.english: At last he felt as if his good-humour must find some outlet.
sentences.chinese: 终于他感到该让他的好心情宣泄一下了。

sentences.english: Now there is relief and catharsis.
sentences.chinese: 现在精神可以放松了，尽情宣泄了。

definition: to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to pour out (emotions)/to unburden oneself (of strong feelings)/to vomit comprehensively
to get sth off one's chest
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
